intro: Codonoboea corneri, commonly known as the Malayan bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are ovate and glossy, often with a waxy coating that helps retain moisture. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Codonoboea corneri is considered a delicate and endangered species.
